Review what’s the main defference between academic and non-academic(mass public) articles?
background: academic words and terms, technical skills, knowledge more formal: the structure of a paper, credential, reference How to read a paper: WHY - WHAT - HOW ? readers are expected to :
recognized the author’s purpose and possible bias (技术路线偏见) distinguish between fact and author’s opinions challenge questionable assumptions and unsupported claims think about possible consequences of author’s claims Extensive Reading and Inclusive Reading extensive reading - focusing on quantity Abstract Introduction inclusive reading background：研究背景 purpose：研究目的 content：内容 method：技术路线 novel idea：创新点 Three-pass Reading Approach: 每篇文章读三遍 the first pass: get general idea the first pass need about 5 ~ 10 minutes, 读摘要、引言、后续所有的小标题、结论、参考文献
what type of paper is this? theoretical or practical? 偏理论还是偏实践？ an analysis of an existing system or a new proposed one? 分析现有的还是提出新的方法、框架？ a description of a research prototype? 研究类型的介绍？ which other papers is it related to? 关联哪些论文 which theoretical base we need to know? 哪些提前学习的理论知识？ do the assumption as well as conclusions appear to be valid? what are the paper’s main contributions? the second pass: ignore details such as proofs, read with greater care the second pass need about 1 hour 仔细看图、表、插图 留下笔记，掌握论文内容。
the third pass: understand paper in depth virtually re-implement the paper ：复现论文 identify not only a paper’s innovations but also its hidden faliings and assumptions：不仅关注创新点，也要找到作者隐藏的缺点
write down ideas for future work：思考对后续工作的帮助 reconstruct the entire structure of the paper from memory：重构论文框架 identify its strong and weak points：找到优点和缺点 pinpoint implicit assumptions, missing citations to relevant work, and potential issues with experimental or analytical techniques Take Notes 做笔记 Prepare for paper writing good notes should be clarity, simple 不要摘抄 Literature Survey 追内容 追作者 追期刊
title: 文献阅读的方法与技巧

Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.
In this example we will be using KaTeX
Create a partial under /layouts/partials/math.html Within this partial reference the Auto-render Extension or host these scripts locally. Include the partial in your templates like so: 1 2 3 {{ if or .Params.math .Site.Params.math }} {{ partial "math.html" . }} {{ end }} To enable KaTeX globally set the parameter math to true in a project’s configuration To enable KaTeX on a per page basis include the parameter math: true in content files Note: Use the online reference of Supported TeX Functions
Examples Inline math: $\varphi = \dfrac{1+\sqrt5}{2}= 1.6180339887…$
$$ \varphi = 1+\frac{1} {1+\frac{1} {1+\frac{1} {1+\cdots} } } $$
title: Math Typesetting

Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.
The emojify function can be called directly in templates or Inline Shortcodes.
To enable emoji globally, set enableEmoji to true in your site’s configuration and then you can type emoji shorthand codes directly in content files; e.g.
🙈 :see_no_evil: 🙉 :hear_no_evil: 🙊 :speak_no_evil:
The Emoji cheat sheet is a useful reference for emoji shorthand codes.
N.B. The above steps enable Unicode Standard emoji characters and sequences in Hugo, however the rendering of these glyphs depends on the browser and the platform. To style the emoji you can either use a third party emoji font or a font stack; e.g.
1 2 3 .emoji { font-family: Apple Color Emoji, Segoe UI Emoji, NotoColorEmoji, Segoe UI Symbol, Android Emoji, EmojiSymbols; }
title: Emoji Support
